wikiFreeText:
=Acquisition=
The devs gave this cape to some of the lucky players, as thanks for their successful contribution of quest texts. The quest texts were eventually used in the game.

These lucky players were greeted with the following message in their ChatWarsBot.
 Tonight is the night. This night you were blessed by the gods. They decided to come down and gift you, PlayerName, with a cheese basket. The catch is, this basket is not made out of cheese and it's not even a basket.
  
 Right now it includes:
 :Present: Assistant box x 1
 Bard's Cape x 1

wikiNote: every info missing besides recipe. that needs to be checked

freeText: It was introduced with the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]] and is used in crafting tier 3 :Bookblue: equipment.

wikiNote: recipe complete, other info might be missing

description: A cloak designed to give praise to the Dev Gods, it features gems outlining the edges of the orange and yellow fabric, representing fire. In the center is their class, requesting a prayer to buff their stats, but nerf the class they dislike the most. Some users sew designs of hammers, silouettes of girls, meat, or foam darts into the free space.

It is a historical item of ChatWars from the event [[Valentines Day 2018]]. It can be consumed with /use_e6. =Possible rewards from eating cakes= * [[Pouch of Gold]] * [[Chocolate]] * [[Special Cake]] * :Bookred: [[Scroll of Rage (Red)]] * :Bookred: [[Scroll of Peace (Red)]] * [[Valentine's Card]]

freeText: This item was renamed to Celestial Bracers from Celestial Gloves shortly after the release of T4 :Bookorange: items.
It was introduced with the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

description: A sword with high honors, it has a mithril core with an edge made of ruby. The outer metal holster has a brilliant silver sheen, outlined by the red of the cutting edge. About 4 feet long, the daunting blade is considered a longsword. With a pure gold crossguard and hilt, wrapped in a thick red twine, its envied by duelists and show-offs
freeText: It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.
It was introduced with the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.
Cheese is [[Pet]] food for [[Mouse]].

'''Chocolate''' is an event item from the historical event[[Valentines Day 2018]] that could be rewarded from eating [[Cake|cake]]. It was reintroduced with the [[Trade Union Event 2019]] and was a possible reward from boxes there. Chocolate is a consumable item that gives the player one :Stamina: stamina, but not increasing the maximum amount of stamina.

freeText: It was introduced to the game with the [[Valentines Day 2018]] event and was removed with the end of the event. It was one of the ingredients needed to craft [[Cake|cakes]].

description: An experimental blend of plants burned to ash, tree resin, intense thermal chilling, and wood dust, the result is a natural weapon made from nature. Some users pride themselves in not using any metal, and is certainly an achievement for the thrifty archer. Capable of firing Steel Arrows, it certainly stands up to the other bows on the same tier.

freeText:
It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].
 The Doomblade Sword gets its name due to the way its manufactured. A steel blade is forged with coke, to give it a black color. After cooling, acid is applied to the blade, coloring and hardening the metal through chemistry. The case hardened finish is a mix of a dark gold, light blue, red and brown, all the way down the black blade.
It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

description: Breaking the norm, the Dragon Mace is decorated with teeth like spikes, mounted on a solid, fist sized orb. Each spike is curled slightly, giving a gnarled, rough appearance to the weapon. The shaft, only about a foot long, is decorated in a dragon like design, which wraps around the handle and curls off the grip in a tail like shape.

description: Similar to regular Gloves, they appear to be made of wool. Except, having 2 layers of Metallic Fiber and 3 layers of Crafted Leather spun thin as twine, and dyed white and sprinkled with filed Sapphire for a glittery effect. Similar to a trick, anyone who fails to recognize this type of glove is in for a real treat, or a stabbing.

description: An eerie translucent metal, the users face is visible through the faceplate similar to the metal of the Armor or rest of helmet. Shaped like a skull, it has an outwards curve in the rear before following the inward vertical indent of the neck. Entirely closed off, both the viewer and enemies can view inwards to see eachother in the face of combat.

description: Designed by castle leaders and war generals, the Hailstorm Bow was taken from the idea of a blizzard. Capable of using Steel Arrows, arrows are polished until glistening, and shot in a snowstorm like hail of arrows. The bow itself is a wrap of milkstone and a mithril base, providing more power and flexibility than the tier below it.

description: Much like the matching armor, the Hunter Bow aims for lightweight use. Mithril is forged with iron internals, to allow more flexibility rather than having a solid piece of metal bend, and roped off with a thicker piece of metal twine. Being too strong for Wooden Arrows, Steel Arrows are recommended for use.

freeText: It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

freeText:
It was added to the game with the April 3, 2018 update.

 Taking motivation from the chestpiece of the same set, the mithril blade is more advanced than the castle shop's dagger. Shaped like a kitchen knife, one side has a blade, while the other side is a ripple of serrated, thick, bent teeth. Exceeding in stabbing, slashing, hacking and even sawing, the Hunter Dagger takes those off guard with ease.
It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.

description: The King's Defender is a tribute to the castle of which it was made. The metal, dyed and mixed with natural elements during forging, is left in castle complementary colors, and smithed with the honors of castle leadership. Recognizeable by the colors, its also customized by the warriors of each castle in any prideful way they seem fit. Cheers!
wikiNote: first draft of new forms page to fix '
wikiFreeText: The King's Defender is a tribute to the castle of which it was made. The metal, dyed and mixed with natural elements during forging, is left in castle complementary colors, and smithed with the honors of castle leadership. Recognizeable by the colors, its also customized by the warriors of each castle in any prideful way they seem fit. Cheers!

freeText: With a leash you can put your [[Pet|pet]] into [[Pet#Sheltering|shelter]].

Half of a leather hide folded over, cut down the middle and sewn at the chin, a simple cowl is produced. Brown and color and thin, it drapes over the sides of your head and covers your neck. With the benefit of being waterproof and light weight, its great for disguising or concealing your identity.

description: Perhaps the fastest firing bow for its tier, it's nicknamed lightning respectively. Cleanly releasing energy on firing, and able to be drawn back 25% further than the Composite or Hailstorm bow, it prides itself in being able to punch through most armors. Featuring a 'tier' like design, the ripples help conserve energy in the frame.

description: Matching the armor of the same name, the Lion Knife has a lion theme. About 8 inches long and rocking a clip point blade, it yells for a challenger. Two lion heads sit on each side of the hilt for intimidation, rather than gems for being flashly. The golden hilt is made from real gold, glazed with a gloss to help prevent damage to the weak metal.

freeText: The Manwolf Knife was obtainable in the [[Monster Hunt 2018]] event. Unlike other [[Dagger|daggers]], this dagger can't be enchanted.
It was introduced in the [[Advanced Crafting]] update.  The item can be traded with [[Exchange]] :Exchange:.

It can be found in [[Quest|quests]] if the player is [[Level|level]] 40 or higher. It can also be crafted with [[Crafting (Skill)]] 3 or higher; available to [[Blacksmith|blacksmiths]] or other players through [[Master Shop|blacksmith's shops]]. It is used in crafting tier 3 :Bookblue: equipment.

ammunition: Broad Arrows Pack, Compound Arrows Pack, Heavy Arrows Pack

freeText: It was introduced to the game with the [[Valentines Day 2018]] event and was removed with the end of the event. It was one of the ingredients needed to craft [[Cake|cakes]].

Top of the line for daggers found in the shop, the Catalina Blue knife is sharp as a razor, and durable enough to be hammered and bent at will. With an edge hard enough to scratch mid-grade quality steel, many warriors cherish the blade. Some models even feature a loop, capable of being strapped to a user's wrist to prevent being lost in combat.

Unlike other [[Weapon|weapons]] the {{PAGENAME}} is listed under ''Equipment'' in the [[Shop|shop]] and not weapons, but it uses the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot to be equipped, as all other [[Weapon|weapons]] do.

ammunition: Broad Arrows Pack, Compound Arrows Pack, Heavy Arrows Pack

description: A heavyset piece of armor with a brass like tinge, its easily compared to dwarven ingot. Decorated with glory filled eagles, intricate designs of swirls and vines, and 3 sapphires on the chest, this heavy armor is top of the line for any brute that would like to hold the line and defend their castle.

description: Forged in two halves, they are reinforced in the middle by a strip of metal. The neck and chin are low on the user, where it connects to the armor like a metal bracket, hooking and locking to the chestpiece. 5 indivdual latches help ensure the wearer never loses their helmet, from the horde of invaders that clamber against the walls.

description: The handcrafted shield features an emblazoned emblem of your castle's symbol in gold thread, inserted into the small depths of an etching. The gold twinkles out from the bronze like overlay of the shield, triangle in shape. It sharply bends downwards, and raises in the corners to provide a wide area of protection for the castle defenders.

wikiFreeText:
==Flavor text==
 Silver is wrapped over an iron core to give a neat appearance but strength for heavy duty use. About 4 foot long and thin, the sword is popular for half-swording, where the blade is gripped to increase control, and used like a knife. The blade is as popular for combat as it is for sport, where some dulled down swords are used in fencing.

wikiFreeText: =Acquisition= When starting the game and using the button "Me" or typing /me, the player will find a short notice on the top of the message: :Exclamationmark: Please report to your captain in the castle chat. The password is ZOM ODO. ''(Note: The password is randomly generated for each player)'' Joining the linked castle chat and typing out those letters given in the password awards the player with a cape, that can be equipped next to all standard equipment. Earned: '''[[Royal Guard Cape]]'''. Check /inv to wear it. =Trivia= In earlier versions of the game the {{PAGENAME}} could be bought in the [[Shop|castle shop]] for 1 :Gold:, this got deactivated later on and now the item can only be acquired through [[Captain Arthur]].

description: The Skull Crusher features a mushroom shaped hammer head, which pans out before returning inwards on a central stalk. Attached to the mushroom lips are several inch long blades, wide for blunt, penetrating power when swung. About 5 feet long, the Skull Crusher invites users to drop their shield and bash others... both shields, and people.

description: A smart stick. Given out to those who helped create the encyclopedia of the land, or wiki, detailing all armors, weapons, events, craftables, resources, and parts... A laborous task. About the size of a staff, it's capped with an energizing green orb, giving the wielder extra stamina and seemingly luck. Thank you for helping!
freeText: It is a a special reward given to selected players for working on the chatwars wiki. It gives +2 :Stamina: stamina and +2 :Luck: luck.

It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

 Nicknamed the Storm Cloak due to an accident in a thunderstorm, the Storm Cloak is a favorite among assassins. Essentially a reinforced Royal Cape, it has a newly attached hood and metal weave to the inside. Capable of stopping some arrows and most dagger strikes, many people enjoy the added protection.

It was introduced with the [[Game_updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]]
 With a name like Thundersoul, you'd expect it to spark. A mithril-steel hybrid fades from dark blue to shining steel at the tip, and is etched with zig-zagging lines of imitation lightning outlined in white, before darkening as it fades to the steel. A bold 3 and a half feet long, it's nicknamed Thunder due to the crackling produced during forging.
It was introduced in the [[Game updates/2018-06-30|June 30th, 2018 game update]].

Equipping a torch in the [[Weapon|Off Hand Weapon]] slot reduces the time of the [[Quest|quests]] :Forest:[[Forest]], :Swamp:[[Swamp]] and :Valley:[[Valley]] by one minute, but only at the [[Time|time of day]] night. It also increases the loot found at night in Forest. Torches can randomly break during quests.

description: Similar to a Lion Helmet, except wolf like. A steel helmet is made as a base, before a fake mouth and skull are formed and added. With fur, it resembles a wolf's head. Offering all around protection intimidation even without a full set, many users value the animalistic style of this helmet. Users are advised to avoid adding silver trim, however.
